page.title: 15JUDY WOODS, WYKE
page.content: Judy Woods is the largest area of woodland in our block, comprising mainly of mature oak and beech with a scattering of sycamore, hazel, birch and hawthorn. During spring, large areas of the woodland floor are carpeted with bluebells and small patches of wood sorrel and anenomes. The woodland is looked after by Bradford Met. Council and access to the general public is unrestricted. As a result, the area is criss-crossed by many paths which extend into the surrounding farmland. The scattered copses and isolated mature trees make the area picturesque and provide a rich habitat for bird life. Blue tits, sparrows, magpies, rooks, blackbirds and thrushes are common with owls and woodpeckers more frequently heard and a growing number of kestrels being seen.
